Poke /poke/ is a raw fish salad served as an appetizer in Hawaiian cuisine, 
and sometimes as an entree. Poke is the Hawaiian verb for "section" or "to slice 
or cut". Traditional forms are aku (an oily tuna) and he'e (octopus). Increasingly 
popular ahi poke is generally made with yellowfin tuna. ... The traditional 
Hawaiian poke consists of fish that has been gutted, skinned,...
